decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (FIG 01; 804/RDP/P11 (received 18/05/2012); 804/RDP/P11 A P13 A; P14 A; P15 A; P16 A; P17 A; P18 A P19 A P01-1 A (received 09/08/2012); 804/RDP/P12 B (received 11/04/2013) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, unless otherwise superseded by drawings LSD156/04/005 rev H received on 16 October 2015 and LSD156_04_006 rev M and LSD156/06/030 rev A received on 19 May 2016 or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.

Condition : 3 - Cycle parking shall be implemented on the site in acordence with details contained within application 01054/83-93/P13(3i, 4, 7) approved on 6 July 2015. Otherwise before the development commences, details of cycle parking shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority and the spaces shown on the approved drawing shall be available for use before first occupation of the development and thereafter maintained and retained as such.

Condition : 4 - Hard and soft landscaping shall be implemented on the site in acordence with details contained within application 01054/83-93/P13(3i, 4, 7) approved on 6 July 2015. Otherwise No development shall take place until full details of both hard and soft landscape works have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority and these works shall be carried out as approved.  These details shall include (proposed finished levels or contours; means of enclosure; car parking layouts; other vehicle and pedestrian access and circulation areas; hard surfacing material; minor artefacts and structures (eg. furniture, play equipment, refuse or other storage units, signs, lighting etc); proposed and existing functional services above and below ground (eg drainage power, communications cables, pipelines etc. indicating lines, manholes, supports etc); retained historic landscape features and proposals for restoration, where relevant).  Soft landscape works shall include (planting plans; written specifications (including cultivation and other operations associated with plant and grass establishment); schedules of plants, noting species, plant sizes and proposed numbers/densities where appropriate; implementation programme)

Condition : 5 - All hard and soft landscape works shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.  The works shall be carried out prior to the occupation of any part of the development or in accordance with the programme agreed with the local planning authority

Condition : 6 - The scheme shall be implemented in accordence with the scheme for decontamination approved within application 01054/83-93/P13(3-11,13) on 18 March 2015. Otherwise before the development hereby permitted commences:
a.	A contaminated land Phase 1 desk study report shall be submitted to, and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Should the Phase 1 report recommend that a Phase 2 site investigation is required, then this shall be carried out and submitted to, and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The site shall be investigated by a competent person to identify the extent and nature of contamination. The report should include a tiered risk assessment of the contamination based on the proposed end use of the site.  Additional investigation may be required where it is deemed necessary.
b.	If required, a scheme for decontamination of the site shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority, for written approval.  The scheme shall account for any comments made by the Local Planning Authority before the development hereby permitted is first occupied.
   During the course of the development:
c.	The Local Planning Authority shall be notified immediately if additional contamination is discovered during the course of the development. A competent person shall assess the additional contamination, and shall submit appropriate amendments to the scheme for decontamination in writing to the Local Planning Authority for approval before any work on that aspect of development continues.  
 	  Before the development is first brought into use:
d.	The agreed scheme for decontamination referred to in clauses b) and c) above, including amendments, shall be fully implemented and a written validation (closure) report submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval.

Condition : 7 - Boundary treatment shall be implmented in accordence with details contained within application 01054/83-93/P13(3i,4,7)  approved on 6 July 2016. Otherwise no development shall take place until there has been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority a plan indicating the positions, design, materials and type of boundary treatment to be erected.  The boundary treatment shall be completed before the building is occupied) or in accordance with a timetable agreed in writing with the local planning authority.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.

Condition : 8 - The proposal shall be constructed in materials approved within application 01054/83-93/P13(8) on 17 June 2016 unless otherwise superseded by this current application. Otherwise no development shall take place until samples of the materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the hereby permitted have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.
Condition : 9 - Balconies shall be installed on the property in accordence with drawing LSD156/06/030 rev A received on 19 May 2016.
Condition : 10 - The scheme of sound insulation detailed in the acoustic report by KP Acoustics dated 18/09/2012 shall be carried out before any part of the development hereby permitted is occupied.

Condition : 11 - Vehicle charging points shall be provided in accordence with the details approved within application 01054/83-93/P13(11i,12) on 2 June 2016. Otherwise before the development commences details of active and passive electric vehicle charging points shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority and the spaces shown on the approved drawing shall be available for use before first occupation of the development and thereafter retained and maintained as such.

Condition : 12 - The proposal shall be implemented in accordence with the details contained within the Energy Submitted approved within application 01054/83-93/P13(11i,12) on 2 July 2016. Otherwise prior to the commencment of development, a revised Energy Statement shall be submitted to, and approved in writing by, the local planning authority detailing how the requirements of policy 5.2 of the London Plan 2011. The development shall be compeleted in accrodance with the apprved details prior to the occupatino of the building and thereafter maintained as such.

Condition : 13 - The scheme shall be implemented in accordnce with mitigation measures in terms of impact on television reception approved within application 01054/83-93/P13(3-11,13)  on 18 March 2015. Otherwise prior to the commencement of development, a report detailing the impact (if any) of the development on television reception to properties in the vicinity including mitigiation measures shall be submitted to, and approved in writing by, the local planning authority. The approved mitigation measures shall be completed in accordance with the approved details prior to the occupation of the development.
description: Variation to condition 2 (approved plans) to change facade material from render to fibre-cement cladding and amended fenestration and condition 9 (balcony details) to re-orientate the balconies and facade materials following planning permission 01054/83-93/P13 dated 14/02/2014 for the construction of a fourth and part fifth floor and the conversion of the first, second and third floors from offices (use class B1) to create 27 flats with associated parking and amenity space (existing ground floor offices to be retained)
